page.title: 09FARMING.
page.content: There is quite a lot of farming in this area,and a plantation forest in the north-west corner. The main area is used for grazing or for growing grass for silage or hay. Silage is cut and stored fresh in enclosures, but grass for hay needs drying before being made into bales which are stored in barns. Most of the cattle are dairy cattle, but some are kept for beef.The silage and hay are kept for the cows to eat in winter when they are stall fed. Sheep graze in this area, but the main sheep grazing area is west of Stonyhurst College.The sheep are sheared once a year and the wool sent off to make clothes.The lambs are slaughtered for meat.
